elements.text: PART ONE
REPRISE FROM ‘PROTECT AND SURVIVE’:
FX: TARDIS FINISHES LANDING
The TARDIS. It worked! Ace, it worked!
FX: FOLLOW THEM AS THEY TROT EXCITEDLY OVER TO TARDIS.
Hang about, it’s black. Something has turned it black.
Who cares what colour it is, it’s here isn’t it?
Doctor? Doctor, are you in there?
FX: ACE PUSHES DOOR OPEN, CUT TO:
80. INT. BLACK TARDIS — CONTROL ROOM [CONTINUOUS] (NB: REVISED
FX: ACE AND HEX ENTER
(RUSHING TO CONSOLE) Okay, we’ve gotta get out of here before this dimension collapses.
(SEEING ARISTIDES) Er, Hex.
(AT CONSOLE, OBLIVIOUS) First, close the doors, then I think I can remember the right sequence of switches on the console —
FX: DOORS CLOSE
This switch first...
FX: BUTTONS PRESSED
Hex.
What?
FX: HEX STOPS PRESSING BUTTONS AS TARDIS TAKES OFF.
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 2
We’re not alone in here. Look.
Oh my — [God]
FX: FUTURISTIC GUN COCKED
Don’t move, either of you.
I don’t believe it.
(TO ARISTIDES) What are you doing here?
Nice to see you too, Miss McShane. I might ask the same question.
Yeah, and who’s your friend with the gun?
Captain? You know these people?
Just keep them covered, Private.
I’ll ask again, shall I? What are you doing here?
More to the point — what have you done with the Doctor?
MUSIC: OPENING THEME
SCENE 1: INT. BLACK TARDIS — CONTROL ROOM [CONTINUOUS]
FX: TARDIS IN FLIGHT — TV MOVIE FX
Done, Mr Schofield? We’ve not done anything with the Doctor.
Yeah, chinny reckon. So how did the Forge get hold of the TARDIS?
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 3
Believe it or not, Miss McShane — I’m not with the Forge. Not any more.
Course you’re not — (NEEDLING HER) — Lysandra.
What’s with the TARDIS paint job? Why’s it black?
Captain, what are they talking about?
You wanna watch who you hang around with, soldier. Your C.O., she’s got some well dodgy mates.
That’s as maybe. But we’re with the Doctor.
Let’s get one thing straight, Private Benjamin. —
Private Morgan, actually. Sally Morgan —
Yeah, whatever. We’re with the Doctor. Most likely her goons have got him.
I told you. I’m not with the Forge.
The Forge, C-4, Monster Raving Loonies — I don’t care what you call [yourself]
(INTERRUPTING) Just listen, for once. We’re with the Doctor.
But you’re not, are you? With him, I mean.
Not right now, no. He just stepped out [and]-
FX: WHUMP AS TARDIS LURCHES — ALL STUMBLE
What was that?
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 4
(FX: CHECKING TARDIS CONTROLS) I’1ll see where we are...
Oi, Lysandra! Get off the controls!
Wherever we were, we’ve been expelled into the vortex. It’s-
(RUNNING & GRABBING ARISTEDES) I said. Don’t touch the console!
Ace!
(FX: COCKING PISTOL) Don’t move, Mr Schofield.
(STRUGGLING WITH ACE) Get your hands off me, McShane.
(STRUGGLING) You get your hands off the TARDIS!
(STRUGGLING) Morgan!
(RUNNING & GRABBING ACE) The Captain said — Get! Off!
FX: CRASH — ACE THROWN INTO DOCTOR'S READING CHAIR
Two against one? That’s not fair.
Nurse Schofield — make sure Ace is OK. Morgan doesn’t know her own strength.
What did that chair ever do to you, eh? Here, gimme your hand...
(GETTING UP) I can do it myself. (SARCASTIC) Thanks for your help, Hex.
Keep them covered, Private. (BEAT) You’ve had your little tantrum. Now. Can we actually talk?
Don’t point that pistol at me, Sergeant Barbie.
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 5
No need for the gun is there? Isn’t it obvious what’s happened?
And what’s that?
You and... Morgan, right? You’ve gotta be from the future. The Doctor’s future. He must be travelling with youse two after we've, er.. left. (BEAT) Or something?
Not just a pretty face, are you?
You think we’re in a future version of your TARDIS?
Yeah. Must be.
Nice theory, Hex, mate. (HOLDING UP BOOK) Only I think this stuffs it up.
A book?
(READING) ‘The Tale of Beowulf’. It was here. In his armchair.
How does that invalidate Schofield’s theory?
‘Cos the Doctor was reading it last time I saw him.
Let me see. (BEAT) You’re not going to assault me again?
(CONSIDERING) Not planning to. No.
Private. Lower your weapon. Stand down.
(HOLSTERING PISTOL) Yes, Ma’am.
(TAKING BOOK FROM ACE) Yes. I’ve seen this book before. He was doing some research. For our next mission.
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 6
Hang on. I’m getting my head round this. The Doctor was reading that exact same book last time we all saw him?
Could be coincidence?
You don’t believe that any more than I do, Lysandra.
Our Doctor and their Doctor — he’s one and the same?
It certainly looks that way.
So, he’s what? Flying around with me and Ace, then the minute our backs are turned, he’s off with you two?
Surely we'd know if we were all living here? How’s that even possible?
I’m not sure. Yet. But I’d really like to ask him.
You’d have to find him first.
Last time you saw him.. You said he just walked out?
I was fetching the weapons. The TARDIS — jumped. The doors opened. And then you two raced in.
(REALISATION DAWNS) It’s him, isn’t it? The Doctor. He’s doing it again.
We don’t know anything yet. These two could be making it up.
Come on, Ace. This is him all over. (ANGRY) I don’t believe it!
Hex...
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 7
I should have known, back in London. Should have just kept walking, after he lied to me about me Mam...
There must be a plan. There’s always a plan.
(ANGRY) Well, I’ve had it with his plans. Where is he?
Hex, calm down. You know what he’s like.
(SHOUTING) You in here, Doctor? D’you hear me? I’ve had it!
Don’t touch the controls, Schofield.
(ANGRY) Don’t you tell him what to do. (SOFTER) Hex. Mate. There’s gonna be an explanation for this. He’s [just-]
(INTERRUPTING) I’ve heard it before. We’ve just been through a nuclear holocaust. You think that was his plan, too? (TO ARISTIDES) Captain? Get us back to London. Now.
Hex, wait...
(DESCENDING CONTROL STEPS) I don’t wanna hear it, Ace. (EXITING INTO CORRIDOR) I’m getting my gear and I’m going.
(CALLING) Hex! Come back!
I’ll.. I’1l see if he’s OK. (FOLLOWS HEX)
Hold up, Sergeant Barbie. You don’t even know [him].
(INTERRUPTING) Let her go, Ace. Morgan’s good at.. feelings.
(SOTTO) I’11 bet she is.
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 8
SCENE 2: INT. BLACK TARDIS — CORRIDOR/SALLY’S ROOM

(STOMPING ALONG) Stupid. (BANGING FIST ON WALL) Stupid, stupid. Should have known, he never changes. (MIMICKING ACE) ‘You know what he’s like.’ (STOPPING AND OPENING BEDROOM DOOR) Yeah. Too right I do. (BEAT) Hang on. This isn’t —
FX: SALLY’S APPROACHING FOOTSTEPS
(OFF — CATCHING HIM UP) Schofield! I mean, “Hex”! Wait up.
Leave me alone, Private.
It’s Sally. No can do, I’m afraid. First of all, that’s my bedroom door you’re giving a pasting.
You what? Your door?
And second, ouch. That hand needs looking at.
It’s nothing. Just grazed me knuckles, that’s all.
Look. I’m just as confused as you. If there’s anyone you want to talk to, it’s me. Come on. I’ve a bandage in the bathroom cabinet. (LEADING HEX INTO ROOM)
(FOLLOWING) This is right where my room should be...
Yeah, well — unless you’re claiming the sports bras hanging up over there, this room is most definitely mine.
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 9
SCENE 3: INT. BLACK TARDIS — CONTROL ROOM
So, what do you think’s going on?
Clearly... I mean, assuming you’re not lying through your teeth —
(INTERRUPTING) Which I’m not.
. then clearly, the Doctor is travelling with all of us at once. Without any of us realising.
So how’s he doing it?
More to the point, why’s he doing it?
We’ve both known him long enough to know we won’t get a straight answer.
OK, so we’ve got to work it out for ourselves.
I’1ll run a scan. See who’s on board. (PAUSE) I take it I’m ‘allowed’ to touch the console?
FX: CONTROL BUTTONS BEING PRESSED, READOUTS BEING ACTIVATED
Knock yourself out. I’1ll just... make sure you’re doing it right.
As far as I can tell, we four are the only life-signs on board. Apart from the bats.
He’s out there somewhere. I’m thinking, alternative dimensions? He’s flipping reality inside the TARDIS somehow?
Could be. Not something I’d want to mess around with.
So, he hasn’t shown you how to work the TARDIS properly, then...?
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 10
Just some basics. A few hours’ training a week.
Training? I never got training...
That’s probably too strong a word for it...
You said something before. About a mission?
Each operation has a clear objective. A specific target.
Target?
The Animus. The Great Intelligence. The Mi’en Kalarash. Derleth. To name a few. The Elder Gods, he calls them. He’s got a list somewhere.
Yeah, I’ve met a few. The Toymaker. The Karnas’koi —
Then you’1l know what we’re dealing with, won’t you?
You mentioned weapons. The Doctor wouldn’t go around with a cache of guns.
But canisters of explosive are perfectly acceptable?
I just can’t believe he ferries you two round like his little private army.
Then you’d better start believing. Because that’s exactly what we are.
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 11
SCENE 4: INT. BLACK TARDIS — SALLY’S ROOM
(BANDAGING HEX’S HAND) Nearly done. I’1l just tie off the bandage... (FX: SNIPPING BANDAGE) There.
Nice job. Couldn’t have done much better meself.
Of course. The Captain called you ‘Nurse Schofield’. I take it that’s not a nickname?
Fully qualified, me.
The Doctor and the Nurse. Makes sense I suppose.
Never thought of it like that. (BEAT) Look. It’s nice of you coming after me, but you don’t know what’s happened.
Then tell me.
I don’t even know you. How come you’re here anyway? And what’s all this ‘Yes Ma’am, No Ma’am’ stuff?
We’re a unit. A team. You’ve got to maintain the chain of command. It keeps us alive.
It’s all a bit.. regimented. Formal, like. That’s not how the Doctor works.
Well it’s how we work. (BEAT) You and Ace? Are you...?
No. (LOUDER) No! Just mates.
I suppose it’d be hard doing this alongside someone you... What am I talking about? Mum and Dad managed it.
How’d you mean?
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 12
Military family. My parents worked alongside each other in Specialised Forces.
The family business, yeah? My nan was a midwife. She brought me up.
Snap! Almost. I lived with my Grandad from when I was nine. He’d been a Colonel in Iraq.
I’ve been on the wrong end of quite a few guns, recently. I didn’t think you were really gonna shoot me.
I wouldn’t have needed to. I’ve got the combat moves.
Yeah, well. I might not be a soldier, but I’ve got moves of me own, you know.
I bet. I guess Ace handles all the rough stuff?
She’s not in charge, though she thinks she is. We’re not together, like. But we do care about each other. (BEAT) Come on, then. How did you meet the Doctor?
(BEAT) I helped him.
FX: ‘WHOOSH’ INTO FLASHBACK:
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 13
SCENE 5: INT. BLUEFIRE SYSTEMS OPERATION ROOM [FLASHBACK]
FROM HOUSE OF BLUE FIRE: SCENE 68, ALREADY RECORDED
Everyone — into the TARDIS now. You too, Doctor — Ah.
Yes, I seem to be rather tangled up in all these wires...
FX: REVERSE WHOOSH TO:
SCENE 6: INT. BLACK TARDIS — SALLY’S ROOM
There was a creature that fed on fear. Mine, and my... colleagues’. The Doctor risked his life to save us.
FX: WHOOSH INTO FLASHBACK:
SCENE 7: INT. BLUEFIRE SYSTEMS OPERATION ROOM [FLASHBACK]
FROM HOUSE OF BLUE FIRE: SCENE 68, ALREADY RECORDED
Cool under pressure, Private Morgan. I admire that.
Yes, save the compliments ‘til later, perhaps-?
Asks all the right questions, and even listens to the answers. Obeys the right orders, disregards the wrong ones. Yes, all very admirable qualities. And with one bound, he was free. Come along.
Course, if you’ve got any kind words, Doctor — save them for my C.O. I could use a promotion.
The thing is, Sally Morgan — I was rather hoping you might consider going AWOL instead.
FX: REVERSE WHOOSH TO:
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 14
SCENE 8: INT. BLACK TARDIS — SALLY’S ROOM
So I did. Two weeks later we were tracking down zombie lizards
on a cemetery planet.
You what?
FX: FLASHBACK WHOOSH TO:
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 15
SCENE 9: INT. ALIEN CATACOMBS [FLASHBACK]
(FX: ECHOING STONE TUNNELS, DRIPPING. DOCTOR & SALLY RUNNING UP, DISTANT ECHOING LIZARD HISSES)
(STOPPING) I’ve been meaning to ask. Are you lonely, Sally?
(STOPPING) Doctor. We’re on the run from an army of dead lizards re-animated by their Ancient God. I don’t think now’s the time to discuss my social life.
You may be right. But it does put things in perspective.
I think you’re looking down the wrong end of the telescope.
There’s someone I want you to meet. I think it’s time.
FX: ECHOING DISTANT LIZARD HISSES
We’re stuck underground with no way back to the TARDIS. Everyone else is gone.
I haven’t always taken good enough care of my friends. I’m trying to change. After all these centuries... it’s not easy.
IGNORING HIM) Inventory check. I’ve a bio-tracker. (FX: BEEP
Four shots left in my rifle. (FX: RIFLE COCKED) And you’ve got- an umbrella.
Soldiers have a different outlook. A military life is one of sacrifice. You know that better than most, Sally Morgan.
Doctor — I don’t know if this is really-
FX: CLOSER LIZARD HISSES
Practical as ever, Private. Yes. First things first.
We're getting out of here?
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 16
Indeed. Hand me that bio-tracker. I’m about to do something rather clever to its innards...
FX: REVERSE WHOOSH TO:
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 17
SCENE 10: INT. BLACK TARDIS — SALLY’S ROOM
After that, we found the Captain. We’ve been tracking these ‘Gods’ ever since.
You’ve really put your faith in him, haven’t you?
All I’ve ever seen him do is good. He saves people.
I was like you at first. Trusting. Happy to follow him blindly round the universe. But you’ve gotta be careful.
What do you mean?
Some time, some day, he’1ll let you down. He won’t mean to do it. He might even say it’s for your own good. He might even believe it himself. But he’1ll do it. Just... be prepared.
I can’t believe he’d ever hurt me. Or the Captain. Or you and Ace for that matter.
The thing you’ve gotta remember is — he’s not human. He doesn’t understand. He might know all about space and time and that. But when it comes to how we feel, there’s a great big blank.
He’s let you down.
It was to do with me mam. He knew things. Things he should have told me. I thought I understood. I thought I’d forgiven him. And I suppose a part of me thought he might have changed.
Look — it’s the same for us. All this time together... suddenly we find out we’re not his priority.
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 18
SCENE 11: INT. BLACK TARDIS — CONTROL ROOM
You know what doesn’t make sense?
Everything?
He’s targeting these Elder Gods when he’s with you two. But with me and Hex, they just... turn up.
So it seems.
So where were you going? (BEAT) The book! I did Beowulf at school — only paid attention ‘cos of the fighting.

(PICKING UP BOOK) Well, it’s a twenty-second century edition of a nineteenth century translation of an eleventh century Anglo- Saxon manuscript. Based on a story that originates in the fifth or sixth century. Take your pick.
You could steer the TARDIS? To any of those times?
Never got as far as flying solo.
What happened with you, Lysandra? I tried to find you once. They said you were on Black Ops.
Standard cover story for missing C-4 personnel. In my case, they didn’t know how right they were.
You weren’t the Doctor’s biggest fan.
I changed my mind. Sue me. I’d been made Acting Director — basically a flak-magnet for all the Department’s bad publicity.
After Nimrod.
Three months later, the Doctor came back. And he absolutely knew what was coming.
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 19
FX: WHOOSH INTO FLASHBACK:
SCENE 12: EXT. LONDON 2026 [FLASHBACK]
FX: RUNNING TROOPS & MOVING VEHICLES
(WALKING) Welcome to London, Private Morgan.
(WALKING) I’m... home? But what’s with all the police? The army?
(WALKING) A little after your time, I think. There’s been an... event.
FX: REVERSE WHOOSH TO:
SCENE 13: INT. BLACK TARDIS — CONTROL ROOM
The evacuees had started shipping in. London was in danger of
falling into chaos.
FX: WHOOSH INTO FLASHBACK:
SCENE 14: EXT. LONDON 2026 [FLASHBACK]
What’s happening, Doctor?
There are times when history hangs in the balance. Tipping points. This is one.
FX: REVERSE WHOOSH TO:
SCENE 15: INT. BLACK TARDIS — CONTROL ROOM
And in the confusion, someone burrowed into what was left of
the Archive.
FX: WHOOSH INTO FLASHBACK:
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 20
SCENE 16: EXT. LONDON 2026 [FLASHBACK]
They call themselves the Sons of Kai. The authorities think they’re just anarchist troublemakers.
But they’re more than that?
FX: REVERSE WHOOSH TO:
SCENE 17: INT. BLACK TARDIS — CONTROL ROOM
We had no idea. Controlling them was a creature called the Kai’lizakia. And guess what?
FX: WHOOSH INTO FLASHBACK:
SCENE 18: EXT. LONDON 2026 [FLASHBACK]
Another Evil from the Dawn of Time?
Precisely. Who better qualified to deal with it than us?
No-one!
Actually, I’ve a friend — an acquaintance — who might lend a hand. I’d like you to join her unit incognito — for now.
She’s an officer?
A Captain. I’m rather hoping you’1l get along...
FX: REVERSE WHOOSH TO:
SCENE 19: INT. BLACK TARDIS — CONTROL ROOM
So he fought it. We fought it.
FX: WHOOSH INTO FLASHBACK:
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 21
SCENE 20: INT. UNDERGROUND TUNNELS — LONDON 2026 [FLASHBACK]
FX: GUNFIRE & MONSTROUS ROARS OF MANY-HEADED KAI ’/LIZAKTA
(SHOUTING) Back! Get back! (TO DOCTOR) Doctor, it’s no good.
FX: SCREAMS OF SOLDIER BEING CONSUMED — MORE ROARS
Get your people out, Lysandra. It’s my turn now.
What can you hope to achieve with that — that contraption?
A Cyber-planner’s cerebral cortex, in fact. This creature feeds on chaos... so let’s give it a taste of pure logic.
(FX: BUZZ OF CYBER-PLANNER FEEDBACK — AS IN ‘GIRL WHO NEVER WAS’, PART FOUR, SCENE 68 — AND KAI’LIZAKIA SCREAMS. )
FX: REVERSE WHOOSH TO:
SCENE 21: INT. BLACK TARDIS — CONTROL ROOM
Not long after, he asked me the question...
SCENE 22: EXT. LONDON 2026 [FLASHBACK]
FX: HELICOPTERS, TROOPS — CLEAN-UP OPERATION
(SHOUTING) They’re going to hang me out to dry this time.
(SHOUTING, WALKING AWAY FROM NOISE) Not your fault, Lysandra. The Kai’lizakia was too powerful. Once it saw its chance, there was no stopping it. Well, almost no stopping it.
(WALKING) But the Sons of Kai, they were just... chancers. It shouldn’t have gone that far.
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 22

Chancers with one of the Ancient Powers of the Universe behind them. The Kai’lizakia was always one of the minor Gods, but still dangerous enough once given its head. (CORRECTING HIMSELF) Heads. Ah, here comes Private Morgan.
(RUNNING UP) Everyone accounted for, Captain. The tech from the Crichton Building’s secured. Getting boxed up now for transfer.
You’ve made sure those... particular items, have gone into that... particular box?
Yes, Doctor. Into the TA- (STOPS) Oops.
I wondered where you’d been seconded from, Morgan.
I think, perhaps, we should continue this conversation somewhere a little... quieter.
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 23
SCENE 23: INT. BLACK TARDIS — CONTROL ROOM [FLASHBACK]
(FX: FADE UP B/G HUM. DOORS OPENING. DOCTOR WALKS IN, FOLLOWED BY ARISTIDES & SALLY)
Why’s it black on the outside now? It was white before.
Black and white and blue all over. Sally, would you get the doors, please?
FX: TARDIS DOORS CLOSE
It can be a bit disorientating the first time, Captain...
Don’t worry, Private. I’ve been in this thing before.
(CONSIDERING) Yes. You have. Haven’t you.
And from what I remember, you gave me pretty short shrift.
You had to stay here, Captain. So that I could come back. So that we could do this.
And the others? What happened to them?
Who’s she talking about?
The Doctor had friends with him last time we met. Miss [McShane ]-
(CUTTING HER OFF) Somewhere safe, not that it’s any of your concern. (CHANGING SUBJECT) Private Morgan travels with me now.
So you’re a real cadet?
King’s New Delta Squadron.
But now you take orders from the Doctor?
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 24
I’ve had worse C.O.s.
You know there’s nothing I’d ask you to do that I wouldn’t be willing to do myself, Lysandra.
So why don’t you?
Even I can’t be in two places at once. Well, not without a great deal of forward planning.
We could do with another pair of hands. You said yourself, Captain, it’s not gonna be much fun for you out there.
So. What’s it to be, Captain? Stay here as ‘Acting Director’? Or come with us and take direct action?
Are you trying to recruit me?
Think of it as volunteering.
FX: REVERSE WHOOSH TO:
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 25
SCENE 24: INT. BLACK TARDIS — CONTROL ROOM
(STUNNED) I don’t believe it. Right from the off, he’s been using you to track down these Gods and take them out. Two- timing us!
Ace, I never wanted to replace you in the Doctor's... affections.
Just shut up, Lysandra. I’m trying to work it out.
(LOSING PATIENCE) I’ve had enough of this. Boo-hoo. The Doctor didn’t trust you enough to tell you his great plan. Get over rts
But you haven’t replaced us, have you? We’re still here.
I had noticed.
No. He’s running you like crack commandos. Black clears the way for White. Or is it something else?
The only way we’ll know for sure is by finding him. I don’t like it any more than you, McShane — but he’s forced us into this, so...
. We might as well work together? That what you’re saying?
(TENDERING HAND) Shake on it?
Get real, Lysandra. Best I’ll give you is a temporary ceasefire.
Good enough.
Alright. Let’s take another look at that book, shall we?
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 26
SCENE 25: INT. BLACK TARDIS — SALLY’S ROOM
. So that’s what happened with me Mam. (REACHING INTO POCKET,
OUT WALLET) I’ve got a picture of her, in me wallet. (SHOWS HER) See?
She’s beautiful.
That’s how I remember her. Not all the stuff that came after.
It’s good you’ve got something. (BEAT) Pina coladas.
You what?
I never knew my mum either. Not properly. But pina coladas —she and dad always made them when they came back on leave. I remember the smell. Coconut. Reminds me of her.
Sally, is she — [dead?]
Yeah. Dad too. At least they were together. That’s what they told me.
What happened?
Failed state. Middle of nowhere. Their convoy was ambushed. Dad didn’t survive the first blast. Mum got some of her people clear, but then... (TRAILS OFF)
Sorry, like.
Long time ago. Long time since I told anyone.
Not even Lysandra?
She doesn’t need to know. Nor the Doctor. Although sometimes, I think he does...
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 27
What happened next?
Shipped off home. To Grandad’s. He was so proud when I got my Sign-up papers. Despite everything.
The Doctor reminds you of him, does he?
(AMUSED) Oh, no! But now I think about it, he does remind me of Henry.
Who’s that? Your uncle?
(LAUGHING) No, Henry was Grandad’s cat. Ancient, but sweet. Grey-green eyes. He’d disappear for days on end, and do absolutely anything for a kipper.
Yeah, that sounds like the Doctor. What sort was he?
You know, I’ve no idea. Bit of a moggy really. Black and white.
FX: TARDIS MATERIALISATION SOUND — OFF
Sounds like something’s working.
You never know, the Doctor might’ve turned up. With an explanation.
That’ll have to be one heck of an explanation. OK. I’1ll give him five minutes. I just hope- (PAUSE)
Hope what?
Nothing’s happened to him, like.
(GETTING UP) Come on. Let’s find out.
FX: THEY EXIT INTO CORRIDOR, AT PACE.
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 28
(RUNNING) You know what?
(RUNNING) What?
(RUNNING) Your granddad, my nan. We should hook them up.
(RUNNING) Sucker for a happy ending, aren’t you?
(RUNNING — GOING OFF) Next stop. We find a pub. I’11 buy you the biggest pina colada you’ve ever seen.
(RUNNING — OFF) It’s a date...!
BLACK AND WHITE by Matt Fitton (FINAL) Page 29
SCENE 26: INT. BLACK TARDIS — CONTROL ROOM
FX: SCANNER OPENS
I thought you knew how to use these controls, Lysandra?
I didn’t do anything!
(PUSHING HER OUT OF THE WAY) Let me try.
(ENTERING, FOLLOWED BY SALLY) So, where’ve you brought us,
ladies?
Calmed down a bit, have we?
Yeah. Sorry. Lost it back there,
time out.

So, the Doctor knows Ace and Hex are under threat. The Grim Reaper’s not happy, and it appears (from earlier stories) that the Elder Gods of the Universe are aiming to collect on his behalf, bringing the Old Times with them. The Doctor wants to stop them, and the only way to be sure is to cut them off at source. Which means getting back to the Old Times first. Only the trap has been sprung early, and nobody has a clue. They’re going in completely unprepared. And the Doctor can’t possibly be intending to sacrifice his soldiers for his friends... can he?
